member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.Highcharts
member.summary: The namespace under which all other Highcharts variables are assembled is called Highcharts. var chart1 = new Highcharts.Chart(options);

member.name: M:SharpKit.Highcharts.Highcharts.Chart(SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions,SharpKit.JavaScript.JsAction)
member.summary: This is the constructor for creating a new chart object.
member.param: The chart options, as documented under the heading "The options object"in the left menu.

A function to execute when the chart object is finished loading and rendering. In most cases the chart is built in one thread, but in Internet Explorer version 8 or lessthe chart is sometimes initiated before the document is ready, and in thesecases the chart object will not be finished directly after callingnew Highcharts.Chart(). As a consequence, code that relies on the newly built Chart object should always run in the callback. Defining a chart.event.load handler is equivalent.

member.summary: Add a series to the chart after render time. Note that this method should never be usedwhen adding data synchronously at chart render time, as it adds expense to the calculationsand rendering. When adding data at the same time as the chart is initiated, add the seriesas a configuration option instead.
member.param: The series options, as documented under plotOptions.seriesand under the plotOptions for each series type.
Defaults to true. Whether to redraw the chart after the series is added. See the redraw()method below.
Defaults to true. When true, the series' updating will be animated with default animationoptions. The animation can also be a configuration object with properties durationand easing.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Highcharts.Chart.redraw
member.summary: Redraw the chart after changes have been done to the data or axis extremes. All methodsfor updating axes, series or points have a parameter for redrawing the chart. This istrue by default. But in many cases you want to do more than one operationon the chart before redrawing, for example add a number of points. In those cases it isa waste of resources to redraw the chart for each new point added. So you add the pointsand call chart.redraw() after.

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.Axis
member.summary: A chart can have from 0 axes (pie chart) to multiples. In a normal, single seriescartesian chart, there is one X axis and one Y axis. The X axis or axes are referencedby chart.xAxis, which is an array of Axis objects. If there is only oneaxis, it can be referenced through chart.xAxis[0], and multiple axes haveincreasing indices. The same pattern goes for Y axes. If you need to get the axes from a series object, use the series.xAxis andseries.yAxis properties. These are not arrays, as one series can only be associateddto one X and one Y axis. A third way to reference the axis programmatically is by id. Add an id in the axis configuration options, and get the axis by chart.get(id). Configuration options for the axes are given in options.xAxis and options.yAxis.

The minimum value of the axis' associated series.

The minimum axis value, either automatic or set manually. If the min option is not set and minPadding is0, this value will be the same as dataMin.

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.Series
member.summary: The Series object is the JavaScript representation of each line, area series, pie etc. The object can be accessed in a number of ways. All series and point event handlersgive a reference to the series object. The chart object has a seriesproperty that is a collection of all the chart's series. The point objectsalso have the same reference. Another way to reference the series programmatically is by id. Add an id in the series configuration options, and get the series object by chart.get(id). Configuration options for the series are given in three levels. Optionsfor all series in a chart are given in the plotOptions.series object. Then options for all seriesof a specific type are given in the plotOptions of that type, for example plotOptions.line.Next, options for one single series are given in the series array.

member.name: M:SharpKit.Highcharts.Series.addPoint(SharpKit.JavaScript.JsArray,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add a point to the series after render time.
member.param: The point options. If options isa single number, a point with that y value is appended to the series.If it is an array, it will be interpreted as x and y values respectively. If it is an object, advanced options as outlined under options.point are applied.

Defaults to true. Whether to redraw the chart after the point is added. When adding more thanone point, it is highly recommended that the redraw option beset to false, and instead chart.redraw() is explicitly calledafter the adding of points is finished.
Defaults to false. When shift is true, one point is shifted off the start of the series as one is appended to the end. Use this option for live charts monitoring a value over time.
Defaults to true. When true, the graph will be animated with default animationoptions. The animation can also be a configuration object with properties durationand easing.

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.Renderer
member.summary: Allows direct access to the Highcharts rendering layer in order to draw primitive shapes like circles, rectangles,paths or text directly on a chart, or independent from any chart. The Renderer represents a wrapper object for SVGin modern browsers and VML in IE < 8. An existing chart's renderer can be accessed through chart.renderer. To create a renderer independentfrom a chart, use var renderer = new Highcharts.Renderer(parentNode, width, height); where parentNodeis the HTML element where you want to add it. The Renderer's methods are chained whereever possible, so you can initiate an element then call for example attrand css and add on that element in one statement.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartConfiguration.loading
member.summary: The loading options control the appearance of the loading screen that covers the plot area on chart operations. This screen only appears after an explicit call to chart.showLoading(). It is a utility for developers to communicate to the end user that something is going on, for example while retrieving new data via an XHR connection. The "Loading..." text itself is not part of this configuration object, but part of the lang object.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartConfiguration.navigation
member.summary: A collection of options for buttons and menus appearing in the exporting module.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartConfiguration.pane
member.summary: Applies only to polar charts and angular gauges. This configuration object holds general options for the combined X and Y axes set. Each xAxis or yAxis can reference the pane by index.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartConfiguration.plotOptions
member.summary: The plotOptions is a wrapper object for config objects for each series type. The config objects for each series can also be overridden for each series item as given in the series array. Configuration options for the series are given in three levels. Options for all series in a chart are given in the plotOptions.series object. Then options for all series of a specific type are given in the plotOptions of that type, for example plotOptions.line. Next, options for one single series are given in the series array.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartConfiguration.series
member.summary: The actual series to append to the chart. In addition to the members listed below, any member of the plotOptions for that specific type of plot can be added to a series individually. For example, even though a general lineWidth is specified in plotOptions.series, an individual lineWidth can be specified for each series.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartConfiguration.subtitle
member.summary: The chart's subtitle

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartConfiguration.title

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartConfiguration.tooltip

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartConfiguration.xAxis

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartConfiguration.xAxisArray

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions
member.summary: Options regarding the chart area and plot area as well as general chart options.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.alignTicks
member.summary: When using multiple axis, the ticks of two or more opposite axes will automatically be aligned by adding ticks to the axis or axes with the least ticks. This can be prevented by setting alignTicks to false. If the grid lines look messy, it's a good idea to hide them for the secondary axis by setting gridLineWidth to 0. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.animation
member.summary: Set the overall animation for all chart updating. Animation can be disabled throughout the chart by setting it to false here. It can be overridden for each individual API method as a function parameter. The only animation not affected by this option is the initial series animation, see plotOptions.series => animation. The animation can either be set as a boolean or a configuration object. If true, it will use the 'swing' jQuery easing and a duration of 500 ms. If used as a configuration object, the following properties are supported: duration The duration of the animation in milliseconds. easing When using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear or swing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notably the jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooTools as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing. . Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.animationBoolean
member.summary: Set the overall animation for all chart updating. Animation can be disabled throughout the chart by setting it to false here. It can be overridden for each individual API method as a function parameter. The only animation not affected by this option is the initial series animation, see plotOptions.series => animation. The animation can either be set as a boolean or a configuration object. If true, it will use the 'swing' jQuery easing and a duration of 500 ms. If used as a configuration object, the following properties are supported: duration The duration of the animation in milliseconds. easing When using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear or swing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notably the jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooTools as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing. . Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.animationObject
member.summary: Set the overall animation for all chart updating. Animation can be disabled throughout the chart by setting it to false here. It can be overridden for each individual API method as a function parameter. The only animation not affected by this option is the initial series animation, see plotOptions.series => animation. The animation can either be set as a boolean or a configuration object. If true, it will use the 'swing' jQuery easing and a duration of 500 ms. If used as a configuration object, the following properties are supported: duration The duration of the animation in milliseconds. easing When using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear or swing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notably the jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooTools as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing. . Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.backgroundColor
member.summary: The background color or gradient for the outer chart area. Defaults to "#FFFFFF".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.borderColor
member.summary: The color of the outer chart border. The border is painted using vector graphic techniques to allow rounded corners. Defaults to "#4572A7".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.borderRadius
member.summary: The corner radius of the outer chart border. Defaults to 5.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.borderWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the outer chart border. The border is painted using vector graphic techniques to allow rounded corners. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.className
member.summary: A CSS class name to apply to the charts container div, allowing unique CSS styling for each chart. Defaults to "".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.defaultSeriesType
member.summary: Alias of type.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.events
member.summary: Event listeners for the chart.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.height
member.summary: An explicit height for the chart. By default the height is calculated from the offset height of the containing element. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.ignoreHiddenSeries
member.summary: If true, the axes will scale to the remaining visible series once one series is hidden. If false, hiding and showing a series will not affect the axes or the other series. For stacks, once one series within the stack is hidden, the rest of the stack will close in around it even if the axis is not affected. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.inverted
member.summary: Whether to invert the axes so that the x axis is horizontal and y axis is vertical. When true, the x axis is reversed by default. If a bar plot is present in the chart, it will be inverted automatically. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.margin
member.summary: The margin between the outer edge of the chart and the plot area. The numbers in the array designate top, right, bottom and left respectively. Use the options marginTop, marginRight, marginBottom and marginLeft for shorthand setting of one option. Since version 2.1, the margin is 0 by default. The actual space is dynamically calculated from the offset of axis labels, axis title, title, subtitle and legend in addition to the spacingTop, spacingRight, spacingBottom and spacingLeft options. Defaults to [null]. Defaults to [null].

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.marginBottom
member.summary: The margin between the bottom outer edge of the chart and the plot area. Use this to set a fixed pixel value for the margin as opposed to the default dynamic margin. See also spacingBottom. Defaults to 70.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.marginLeft
member.summary: The margin between the left outer edge of the chart and the plot area. Use this to set a fixed pixel value for the margin as opposed to the default dynamic margin. See also spacingLeft. Defaults to 80.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.marginRight
member.summary: The margin between the right outer edge of the chart and the plot area. Use this to set a fixed pixel value for the margin as opposed to the default dynamic margin. See also spacingRight. Defaults to 50.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.marginTop
member.summary: The margin between the top outer edge of the chart and the plot area. Use this to set a fixed pixel value for the margin as opposed to the default dynamic margin. See also spacingTop. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.plotBackgroundColor
member.summary: The background color or gradient for the plot area. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.plotBackgroundImage
member.summary: The URL for an image to use as the plot background. To set an image as the background for the entire chart, set a CSS background image to the container element. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.plotBorderColor
member.summary: The color of the inner chart or plot area border. Defaults to "#C0C0C0".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.plotBorderWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the plot area border. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.plotShadow
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the plot area. Requires that plotBackgroundColor be set. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.plotShadowBoolean
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the plot area. Requires that plotBackgroundColor be set. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.plotShadowObject
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the plot area. Requires that plotBackgroundColor be set. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.polar
member.summary: When true, cartesian charts like line, spline, area and column are transformed into the polar coordinate system. Requires highcharts-more.js.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.reflow
member.summary: Whether to reflow the chart to fit the width of the container div on resizing the window. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.renderTo
member.summary: The HTML element where the chart will be rendered. If it is a string, the element by that id is used. The HTML element can also be passed by direct reference. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.renderToObject
member.summary: The HTML element where the chart will be rendered. If it is a string, the element by that id is used. The HTML element can also be passed by direct reference. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.resetZoomButton
member.summary: The button that appears after a selection zoom, allowing the user to reset zoom.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.selectionMarkerFill
member.summary: The background color of the marker square when selecting (zooming in on) an area of the chart. Defaults to rgba(69,114,167,0.25). Defaults to rgba(69114,167,0.25),.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.shadow
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the outer chart area. Requires that backgroundColor be set. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.shadowBoolean
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the outer chart area. Requires that backgroundColor be set. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.shadowObject
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the outer chart area. Requires that backgroundColor be set. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.showAxes
member.summary: Whether to show the axes initially. This only applies to empty charts where series are added dynamically, as axes are automatically added to cartesian series. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.spacingBottom
member.summary: The space between the bottom edge of the chart and the content (plot area, axis title and labels, title, subtitle or legend in top position). . Defaults to 10.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.spacingLeft
member.summary: The space between the left edge of the chart and the content (plot area, axis title and labels, title, subtitle or legend in top position). . Defaults to 10.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.spacingRight
member.summary: The space between the right edge of the chart and the content (plot area, axis title and labels, title, subtitle or legend in top position). . Defaults to 10.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.spacingTop
member.summary: The space between the top edge of the chart and the content (plot area, axis title and labels, title, subtitle or legend in top position). . Defaults to 10.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.style
P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.type
member.summary: The default series type for the chart. Can be one of line, spline, area, areaspline, column, bar, pie and scatter. From version 2.3, arearange, areasplinerange and columnrange are supported with the highcharts-more.js component. Defaults to "line".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.width
member.summary: An explicit width for the chart. By default the width is calculated from the offset width of the containing element. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartOptions.zoomType
member.summary: Decides in what dimentions the user can zoom by dragging the mouse. Can be one of x, y or xy. Defaults to "".

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartEvent
member.summary: Event listeners for the chart.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartEvent.addSeries
member.summary: Fires when a series is added to the chart after load time, using the addSeries method. The this keyword refers to the chart object itself One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. Through event.options you can access the series options that was passed to the addSeries method. Returning false prevents the series from being added.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartEvent.click
P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartEvent.load
member.summary: Fires when the chart is finished loading. The this keyword refers to the chart object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. From version 2.0.4, there is also a second parameter to Highcharts.Chart where a callback function can be passed to be executed on chart.load.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartEvent.redraw
member.summary: Fires when the chart is redrawn, either after a call to chart.redraw() or after an axis, series or point is modified with the redraw option set to true. The this keyword refers to the chart object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ChartEvent.selection
T:SharpKit.Highcharts.AnimationOptions
member.summary: The animation can either be set as a boolean or a configuration object. If true, it will use the 'swing' jQuery easing and a duration of 500 ms. If used as a configuration object, the following properties are supported:

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.AnimationOptions.duration
member.summary: The duration of the animation in milliseconds.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.AnimationOptions.easing
member.summary: When using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear or swing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notably the jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooTools as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing.

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.ShadowOptions

member.summary: What frame the button should be placed related to. Can be either "plot" or "chart". Defaults to "plot".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.ResetZoomButton.theme
member.summary: A collection of attributes for the button. The object takes SVG attributes like fill, stroke, stroke-width or r, the border radius. The theme also supports style, a collection of CSS properties for the text. Equivalent attributes for the hover state are given in theme.states.hover.

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.RelativeToType

member.summary: A collection of config options for the menu items. P:SharpKit.Highcharts.GlobalOptions.VMLRadialGradientURL
member.summary: Path to the pattern image required by VML browsers in order to draw radial gradients. Defaults to http://code.highcharts.com/{version}/gfx/vml-radial-gradient.png.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.GlobalOptions.canvasToolsURL
member.summary: The URL to the additional file to lazy load for Android 2.x devices. These devices don't support SVG, so we download a helper file that contains canvg, its dependecy rbcolor, and our own CanVG Renderer class. To avoid hotlinking to our site, you can install canvas-tools.js on your own server and change this option accordingly. Defaults to "http://www.highcharts.com/js/canvas-tools.js".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.GlobalOptions.useUTC
member.summary: Whether to use UTC time for axis scaling, tickmark placement and time display in Highcharts.dateFormat. Advantages of using UTC is that the time displays equally regardless of the user agent's time zone settings. Local time can be used when the data is loaded in real time or when correct Daylight Saving Time transitions are required. Defaults to true.

member.summary: Whether to reverse the order of the legend items compared to the order of the series or points as defined in the configuration object. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.LegendOptions.shadowBoolean
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the legend. A backgroundColor also needs to be applied for this to take effect. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.LegendOptions.shadowObject
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the legend. A backgroundColor also needs to be applied for this to take effect. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.LegendOptions.style
member.summary: CSS styles for the legend area. In the 1.x versions the position of the legend area was determined by CSS. In 2.x, the position is determined by properties like align, verticalAlign, x and y, but the styles are still parsed for backwards compatibility.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.LegendOptions.symbolPadding
member.summary: The pixel padding between the legend item symbol and the legend item text. Defaults to 5.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.LegendOptions.symbolWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the legend item symbol. Defaults to 30.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.LegendOptions.verticalAlign
member.summary: The vertical alignment of the legend box. Can be one of "top", "middle" or "bottom". Vertical position can be further determined by the y option. Defaults to "bottom".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.LegendOptions.width
member.summary: The width of the legend box, not including style.padding. . Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.LegendOptions.x
member.summary: The x offset of the legend relative to it's horizontal alignment align within chart.spacingLeft and chart.spacingRight. Negative x moves it to the left, positive x moves it to the right. The default value of 15 together with align: "center" puts it in the center of the plot area. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.LegendOptions.y
member.summary: The vertical offset of the legend relative to it's vertical alignment verticalAlign within chart.spacingTop and chart.spacingBottom. Negative y moves it up, positive y moves it down. Defaults to 0.

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.LoadingOptions
member.summary: The loading options control the appearance of the loading screen that covers the plot area on chart operations. This screen only appears after an explicit call to chart.showLoading(). It is a utility for developers to communicate to the end user that something is going on, for example while retrieving new data via an XHR connection. The "Loading..." text itself is not part of this configuration object, but part of the lang object.

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.PaneOptions
member.summary: Applies only to polar charts and angular gauges. This configuration object holds general options for the combined X and Y axes set. Each xAxis or yAxis can reference the pane by index.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PaneOptions.background
member.summary: An object, or array of objects, for backgrounds. Sub options include backgroundColor (which can be solid or gradient), innerWidth, outerWidth, borderWidth, borderColor.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PaneOptions.backgroundArray
member.summary: An object, or array of objects, for backgrounds. Sub options include backgroundColor (which can be solid or gradient), innerWidth, outerWidth, borderWidth, borderColor.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PaneOptions.center
member.summary: The center of a polar chart or angular gauge, given as an array of [x, y] positions. Positions can be given as integers that transform to pixels, or as percentages of the plot area size. Defaults to ['50%', '50%'].

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PaneOptions.endAngle
member.summary: The end angle of the polar X axis or gauge value axis, given in degrees where 0 is north. Defaults to startAngle + 360.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PaneOptions.startAngle
member.summary: The start angle of the polar X axis or gauge axis, given in degrees where 0 is north. Defaults to 0.

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.CenterOptions
member.summary: The center of a polar chart or angular gauge, given as an array of [x, y] positions. Positions can be given as integers that transform to pixels, or as percentages of the plot area size. Defaults to ['50%', '50%'].

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotOptions
member.summary: The plotOptions is a wrapper object for config objects for each series type. The config objects for each series can also be overridden for each series item as given in the series array. Configuration options for the series are given in three levels. Options for all series in a chart are given in the plotOptions.series object. Then options for all series of a specific type are given in the plotOptions of that type, for example plotOptions.line. Next, options for one single series are given in the series array.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.allowPointSelect
member.summary: Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.animation
member.summary: Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. Since version 2.1, the animation can be set as a configuration object. Please note that this option only applies to the initial animation of the series itself. For other animations, see #chart.animation and the animation parameter under the API methods. The following properties are supported: duration: The duration of the animation in milliseconds. easing: When using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear or swing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notably the jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooToos as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing. . For polar charts, the animation is disabled in legacy IE browsers. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.animationBoolean
member.summary: Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. Since version 2.1, the animation can be set as a configuration object. Please note that this option only applies to the initial animation of the series itself. For other animations, see #chart.animation and the animation parameter under the API methods. The following properties are supported: duration: The duration of the animation in milliseconds. easing: When using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear or swing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notably the jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooToos as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing. . For polar charts, the animation is disabled in legacy IE browsers. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.animationObject
member.summary: Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. Since version 2.1, the animation can be set as a configuration object. Please note that this option only applies to the initial animation of the series itself. For other animations, see #chart.animation and the animation parameter under the API methods. The following properties are supported: duration: The duration of the animation in milliseconds. easing: When using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear or swing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notably the jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooToos as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing. . For polar charts, the animation is disabled in legacy IE browsers. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.color
member.summary: The main color or the series. In line type series it applies to the line and the point markers unless otherwise specified. In bar type series it applies to the bars unless a color is specified per point. The default value is pulled from the options.colors array.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.connectEnds
member.summary: Polar charts only. Whether to connect the ends of a line series plot across the extremes. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.connectNulls
member.summary: Whether to connect a graph line across null points. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.cropThreshold
member.summary: When the series contains less points than the crop threshold, all points are drawn, event if the points fall outside the visible plot area at the current zoom. The advantage of drawing all points (including markers and columns), is that animation is performed on updates. On the other hand, when the series contains more points than the crop threshold, the series data is cropped to only contain points that fall within the plot area. The advantage of cropping away invisible points is to increase performance on large series. . Defaults to 300.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.cursor
member.summary: You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked. Defaults to ''.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.dashStyle
member.summary: A name for the dash style to use for the graph. Applies only to series type having a graph, like line, spline, area and scatter in case it has a lineWidth. The value for the dashStyle include: Solid ShortDash ShortDot ShortDashDot ShortDashDotDot Dot Dash LongDash DashDot LongDashDot LongDashDotDot . Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.enableMouseTracking
member.summary: Enable or disable the mouse tracking for a specific series. This includes point tooltips and click events on graphs and points. For large datasets it improves performance. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.fillColor
member.summary: Fill color or gradient for the area. When null, the series' color is used with the series' fillOpacity. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.fillOpacity
member.summary: Fill opacity for the area. Defaults to .75.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.id
member.summary: An id for the series. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the series object through chart.get(). Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.lineColor
member.summary: A separate color for the graph line. By default the line takes the color of the series, but the lineColor setting allows setting a separate color for the line without altering the fillColor. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.lineWidth
member.summary: Pixel with of the graph line. Defaults to 2.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.point
member.summary: Properties for each single point

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.pointInterval
member.summary: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointInterval defines the interval of the x values. For example, if a series contains one value every decade starting from year 0, set pointInterval to 10. . Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.pointPlacement
member.summary: Possible values: null, "on", "between". In a column chart, when pointPlacement is "on", the point will not create any padding of the X axis. In a polar column chart this means that the first column points directly north. If the pointPlacement is "between", the columns will be laid out between ticks. This is useful for example for visualising an amount between two points in time or in a certain sector of a polar chart. Defaults to null in cartesian charts, "between" in polar charts.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.pointStart
member.summary: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointStart defines on what value to start. For example, if a series contains one yearly value starting from 1945, set pointStart to 1945. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.selected
member.summary: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.shadowBoolean
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.shadowObject
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.shadow
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.showCheckbox
member.summary: If true, a checkbox is displayed next to the legend item to allow selecting the series. The state of the checkbox is determined by the selected option. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.showInLegend
member.summary: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.stacking
member.summary: Whether to stack the values of each series on top of each other. Possible values are null to disable, "normal" to stack by value or "percent". Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.states
member.summary: A wrapper object for all the series options in specific states.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.stickyTracking
member.summary: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.threshold
member.summary: The Y axis value to serve as the base for the area, for distinguishing between values above and below a threshold. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.tooltip
member.summary: A configuration object for the tooltip rendering of each single series. Properties are inherited from tooltip. Overridable properties are headerFormat, pointFormat, valueDecimals, xDateFormat, valuePrefix and valueSuffix. Defaults to {}.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.trackByArea
member.summary: Whether the whole area or just the line should respond to mouseover tooltips and other mouse or touch events. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.turboThreshold
member.summary: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Defaults to 1000.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.visible
member.summary: Set the initial visibility of the series. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaOptions.zIndex
member.summary: Define the z index of the series. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaEvent.checkboxClick
member.summary: Fires when the checkbox next to the series' name in the legend is clicked.. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The state of the checkbox is found by event.checked. Return false to prevent the default action which is to toggle the select state of the series.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaEvent.click
member.summary: Fires when the series is clicked. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. Additionally, event.point holds a pointer to the nearest point on the graph.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaEvent.hide
member.summary: Fires when the series is hidden after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .hide().

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaEvent.legendItemClick
member.summary: Fires when the legend item belonging to the series is clicked. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. The default action is to toggle the visibility of the series. This can be prevented by returning false or calling event.preventDefault().

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaEvent.mouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the graph. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. If the stickyTracking option is true, mouseOut doesn't happen before the mouse enters another graph or leaves the plot area.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaEvent.mouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the graph. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaEvent.show
member.summary: Fires when the series is shown after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .show().

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.AreaDataLabelsOptions.formatter
member.summary: Callback JavaScript function to format the data label. Available data are: this.percentage Stacked series and pies only. The point's percentage of the total. this.point The point object. The point name, if defined, is available through this.point.name. this.series: The series object. The series name is available through this.series.name. this.total Stacked series only. The total value at this point's x value. this.x: The y value. this.y: The y value. Default value: formatter: function() { return this.y; }

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.AreaDataLabelsOptions.overflow
member.summary: How to handle overflowing labels on horizontal axis. Can be undefined or "justify". If "justify", labels will not render outside the plot area. If there is room to move it, it will be aligned to the edge, else it will be removed. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.AreaDataLabelsOptions.padding
member.summary: When either the borderWidth or the backgroundColor is set, this is the padding within the box. Defaults to 2. Defaults to 2.

member.summary: Fires when the point is unselected either programatically or following a click on the point. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PointEvent.update
member.summary: Fires when the point is updated programmatically through the .update() method. The this keyword refers to the point object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The new point options can be accessed through event.options. Returning false cancels the operation.

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.PointPlacementType
member.summary: Possible values: null, "on", "between".

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.AreaTooltipOptions
member.summary: A configuration object for the tooltip rendering of each single series. Properties are inherited from tooltip. Overridable properties are headerFormat, pointFormat, valueDecimals, xDateFormat, valuePrefix and valueSuffix. . Defaults to {}.

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions
member.summary: Options for the tooltip that appears when the user hovers over a series or point.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions.animation
member.summary: Enable or disable animation of the tooltip. In old browsers combined with data-heavy charts, the animation may be slow, so turning it off can be a good idea. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions.backgroundColor
member.summary: The background color or gradient for the tooltip. Defaults to "rgba(255, 255, 255, .85)". Defaults to "rgba(255 255, 255, .85)",.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions.borderColor
member.summary: The color of the tooltip border. When null, the border takes the color of the corresponding series or point. Defaults to "auto".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions.borderRadius
member.summary: The radius of the rounded border corners. Defaults to 5.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions.borderWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the tooltip border. Defaults to 2.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions.crosshairsBoolean
member.summary: Display crosshairs to connect the points with their corresponding axis values. The crosshairs can be defined as a boolean, an array of booleans or an object. Boolean: If the crosshairs option is true, a single crosshair relating to the x axis will be shown. Array of booleans: In an array of booleans, the first value turns on the x axis crosshair and the second value to the y axis crosshair. Use [true, true] to show complete crosshairs. Array of objects: In an array of objects, the first value applies to the x axis crosshair and the second value to the y axis crosshair. For each dimension, a width, color, dashStyle and zIndex can be given. Defaults to null. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions.crosshairsBooleanArray
member.summary: Display crosshairs to connect the points with their corresponding axis values. The crosshairs can be defined as a boolean, an array of booleans or an object. Boolean: If the crosshairs option is true, a single crosshair relating to the x axis will be shown. Array of booleans: In an array of booleans, the first value turns on the x axis crosshair and the second value to the y axis crosshair. Use [true, true] to show complete crosshairs. Array of objects: In an array of objects, the first value applies to the x axis crosshair and the second value to the y axis crosshair. For each dimension, a width, color, dashStyle and zIndex can be given. Defaults to null. Defaults to null.

For each dimension, a width, color, dashStyle and zIndex can be given. Defaults to null. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions.enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the tooltip. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions.footerFormat
member.summary: A string to append to the tooltip format. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions.formatter
member.summary:
Callback function to format the text of the tooltip. Return false to disable tooltip for a specific point on series. A subset of HTML is supported. The HTML of the tooltip is parsed and converted to SVG, therefore this isn't a complete HTML renderer. The following tabs are supported: , , , ,
, . Spans can be styled with a style attribute, but only text-related CSS that is shared with SVG is handled. Since version 2.1 the tooltip can be shared between multiple series through the shared option. The available data in the formatter differ a bit depending on whether the tooltip is shared or not. In a shared tooltip, all properties except x, which is common for all points, are kept in an array, this.points. Available data are: this.percentage (not shared) / this.points[i].percentage (shared) Stacked series and pies only. The point's percentage of the total. this.point (not shared) / this.points[i].point (shared) The point object. The point name, if defined, is available through this.point.name. this.points In a shared tooltip, this is an array containing all other properties for each point. this.series (not shared) / this.points[i].series (shared) The series object. The series name is available through this.series.name. this.total (not shared) / this.points[i].total (shared) Stacked series only. The total value at this point's x value. this.x The x value. This property is the same regardless of the tooltip being shared or not. this.y (not shared) / this.points[i].y (shared) The y value.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions.pointFormat
member.summary: The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.yPrefix and tooltip.ySuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units. Defaults to {series.name}: {point.y}

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions.positioner
member.summary: A callback function to place the tooltip in a default position. The callback receives three parameters: labelWidth, labelHeight and point, where point contains values for plotX and plotY telling where the reference point is in the plot area. The return should be an object containing x and y values, for example { x: 100, y: 100 }.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions.shadow
member.summary: Whether to apply a drop shadow to the tooltip. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions.shared
member.summary: When the tooltip is shared, the entire plot area will capture mouse movement, and tooltip texts for all series will be shown in a single bubble. This is recommended for single series charts and for iPad optimized sites. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions.snap
member.summary: Proximity snap for graphs or single points. Does not apply to bars, columns and pie slices. It defaults to 10 for mouse-powered devices and 25 for touch devices. Defaults to 10/25.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions.style
P:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions.useHTML
member.summary: Use HTML to render the contents of the tooltip instead of SVG. Using HTML allows advanced formatting like tables and images in the tooltip. It is also recommended for rtl languages as it works around rtl bugs in early Firefox. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions.valueDecimals
member.summary: How many decimals to show in each series' y value. This is overridable in each series' tooltip options object. The default is to preserve all decimals.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions.valuePrefix
member.summary: A string to prepend to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object. Defaults to "".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions.valueSuffix
member.summary: A string to append to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object. Defaults to "".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.TooltipOptions.xDateFormat
member.summary: The format for the date in the tooltip header if the X axis is a datetime axis. The default is a best guess based on the smallest distance between points in the chart.

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions
member.summary: The area range is a cartesian series type with higher and lower Y values along an X axis. Requires highcharts-more.js.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.allowPointSelect
member.summary: Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.animation
member.summary: Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. Since version 2.1, the animation can be set as a configuration object. Please note that this option only applies to the initial animation of the series itself. For other animations, see #chart.animation and the animation parameter under the API methods. The following properties are supported: duration: The duration of the animation in milliseconds. easing: When using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear or swing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notably the jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooToos as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing. . For polar charts, the animation is disabled in legacy IE browsers. Defaults to true.

member.summary: Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. Since version 2.1, the animation can be set as a configuration object. member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.color
member.summary: The main color or the series. In line type series it applies to the line and the point markers unless otherwise specified. In bar type series it applies to the bars unless a color is specified per point. The default value is pulled from the options.colors array.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.connectNulls
member.summary: Whether to connect a graph line across null points. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.cropThreshold
member.summary: When the series contains less points than the crop threshold, all points are drawn, event if the points fall outside the visible plot area at the current zoom. The advantage of drawing all points (including markers and columns), is that animation is performed on updates. On the other hand, when the series contains more points than the crop threshold, the series data is cropped to only contain points that fall within the plot area. The advantage of cropping away invisible points is to increase performance on large series. . Defaults to 300.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.cursor
member.summary: You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked. Defaults to ''.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.dashStyle
member.summary: A name for the dash style to use for the graph. Applies only to series type having a graph, like line, spline, area and scatter in case it has a lineWidth. The value for the dashStyle include: Solid ShortDash ShortDot ShortDashDot ShortDashDotDot Dot Dash LongDash DashDot LongDashDot LongDashDotDot . Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.dataLabels
member.summary: Extended data labels for range series types. Range series data labels have no x and y options. Instead, they have xLow, xHigh, yLow and yHigh options to allow the higher and lower data label sets individually.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.enableMouseTracking
member.summary: Enable or disable the mouse tracking for a specific series. This includes point tooltips and click events on graphs and points. For large datasets it improves performance. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.fillColor
member.summary: Fill color or gradient for the area. When null, the series' color is used with the series' fillOpacity. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.fillOpacity
member.summary: Fill opacity for the area. Defaults to .75.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.id
member.summary: An id for the series. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the series object through chart.get(). Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.lineColor
member.summary: A separate color for the graph line. By default the line takes the color of the series, but the lineColor setting allows setting a separate color for the line without altering the fillColor. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.lineWidth
member.summary: Pixel with of the graph line. Defaults to 2.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.point
member.summary: Properties for each single point

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.pointInterval
member.summary: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointInterval defines the interval of the x values. For example, if a series contains one value every decade starting from year 0, set pointInterval to 10. . Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.pointPlacement
member.summary: Possible values: null, "on", "between". In a column chart, when pointPlacement is "on", the point will not create any padding of the X axis. In a polar column chart this means that the first column points directly north. If the pointPlacement is "between", the columns will be laid out between ticks. This is useful for example for visualising an amount between two points in time or in a certain sector of a polar chart. Defaults to null in cartesian charts, "between" in polar charts.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.pointStart
member.summary: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointStart defines on what value to start. For example, if a series contains one yearly value starting from 1945, set pointStart to 1945. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.selected
member.summary: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.shadowBoolean
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.shadowObject
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.shadow
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.showCheckbox
member.summary: If true, a checkbox is displayed next to the legend item to allow selecting the series. The state of the checkbox is determined by the selected option. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.showInLegend
member.summary: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.stacking
member.summary: Whether to stack the values of each series on top of each other. Possible values are null to disable, "normal" to stack by value or "percent". Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.states
member.summary: A wrapper object for all the series options in specific states.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.stickyTracking
member.summary: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.tooltip
member.summary: A configuration object for the tooltip rendering of each single series. Properties are inherited from tooltip. Overridable properties are headerFormat, pointFormat, valueDecimals, xDateFormat, valuePrefix and valueSuffix. . Defaults to {}.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.trackByArea
member.summary: Whether the whole area or just the line should respond to mouseover tooltips and other mouse or touch events. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.turboThreshold
member.summary: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Defaults to 1000.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.visible
member.summary: Set the initial visibility of the series. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeOptions.zIndex
member.summary: Define the z index of the series. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeEvent.checkboxClick
member.summary: Fires when the checkbox next to the series' name in the legend is clicked.. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. The state of the checkbox is found by event.checked. Return false to prevent the default action which is to toggle the select state of the series.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeEvent.click
member.summary: Fires when the series is clicked. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. Additionally, event.point holds a pointer to the nearest point on the graph.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeEvent.hide
member.summary: Fires when the series is hidden after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .hide().

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeEvent.legendItemClick
member.summary: Fires when the legend item belonging to the series is clicked. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. The default action is to toggle the visibility of the series. This can be prevented by returning false or calling event.preventDefault().

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeEvent.mouseOut
member.summary: Fires when the mouse leaves the graph. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. If the stickyTracking option is true, mouseOut doesn't happen before the mouse enters another graph or leaves the plot area.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeEvent.mouseOver
member.summary: Fires when the mouse enters the graph. The this keyword refers to the series object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotAreaRangeEvent.show
member.summary: Fires when the series is shown after chart generation time, either by clicking the legend item or by calling .show().

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.AreaRangeDataLabelsOptions.overflow
member.summary: How to handle overflowing labels on horizontal axis. Can be undefined or "justify". If "justify", labels will not render outside the plot area. If there is room to move it, it will be aligned to the edge, else it will be removed. Defaults to undefined.

member.summary: You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked. Defaults to ''.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.dashStyle
member.summary: A name for the dash style to use for the graph. Applies only to series type having a graph, like line, spline, area and scatter in case it has a lineWidth. The value for the dashStyle include: Solid ShortDash ShortDot ShortDashDot ShortDashDotDot Dot Dash LongDash DashDot LongDashDot LongDashDotDot . Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.enableMouseTracking
member.summary: Enable or disable the mouse tracking for a specific series. This includes point tooltips and click events on graphs and points. For large datasets it improves performance. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.groupPadding
member.summary: Padding between each value groups, in x axis units. Defaults to 0.2.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.grouping
member.summary: Whether to group non-stacked columns or to let them render independent of each other. Non-grouped columns will be laid out individually and overlap each other. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.id
member.summary: An id for the series. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the series object through chart.get(). Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.minPointLength
member.summary: The minimal height for a column or width for a bar. By default, 0 values are not shown. To visualize a 0 (or close to zero) point, set the minimal point length to a pixel value like 3. In stacked column charts, minPointLength might not be respected for tightly packed values. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.point
member.summary: Properties for each single point

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.pointInterval
member.summary: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointInterval defines the interval of the x values. For example, if a series contains one value every decade starting from year 0, set pointInterval to 10. . Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.pointPadding
member.summary: Padding between each column or bar, in x axis units. Defaults to 0.1.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.pointPlacement
member.summary: Possible values: null, "on", "between". In a column chart, when pointPlacement is "on", the point will not create any padding of the X axis. In a polar column chart this means that the first column points directly north. If the pointPlacement is "between", the columns will be laid out between ticks. This is useful for example for visualising an amount between two points in time or in a certain sector of a polar chart. Defaults to null in cartesian charts, "between" in polar charts.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.pointStart
member.summary: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointStart defines on what value to start. For example, if a series contains one yearly value starting from 1945, set pointStart to 1945. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.pointWidth
member.summary: A pixel value specifying a fixed width for each column or bar. When null, the width is calculated from the pointPadding and groupPadding. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.selected
member.summary: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.shadowBoolean
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.shadowObject
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.shadow
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.showCheckbox
member.summary: If true, a checkbox is displayed next to the legend item to allow selecting the series. The state of the checkbox is determined by the selected option. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.showInLegend
member.summary: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.stacking
member.summary: Whether to stack the values of each series on top of each other. Possible values are null to disable, "normal" to stack by value or "percent". Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.states
member.summary: A wrapper object for all the series options in specific states.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.stickyTracking
member.summary: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.tooltip
member.summary: A configuration object for the tooltip rendering of each single series. Properties are inherited from tooltip. Overridable properties are headerFormat, pointFormat, valueDecimals, xDateFormat, valuePrefix and valueSuffix. Defaults to {}.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.turboThreshold
member.summary: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Defaults to 1000.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.visible
member.summary: Set the initial visibility of the series. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotBarOptions.zIndex
member.summary: Define the z index of the series. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotGaugeOptions.animation
member.summary: Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. Since version 2.1, the animation can be set as a configuration object. Please note that this option only applies to the initial animation of the series itself. For other animations, see #chart.animation and the animation parameter under the API methods. The following properties are supported: duration: The duration of the animation in milliseconds. easing: When using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear or swing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notably the jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooToos as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing. . For polar charts, the animation is disabled in legacy IE browsers. Defaults to true.

member.summary: Polar charts only. Whether to connect the ends of a line series plot across the extremes. Defaults to true.

member.summary: Whether to connect a graph line across null points. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotLineOptions.cropThreshold
member.summary: When the series contains less points than the crop threshold, all points are drawn, event if the points fall outside the visible plot area at the current zoom. The advantage of drawing all points (including markers and columns), is that animation is performed on updates. On the other hand, when the series contains more points than the crop threshold, the series data is cropped to only contain points that fall within the plot area. The advantage of cropping away invisible points is to increase performance on large series. . Defaults to 300.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotPieOptions.shadow
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotPieOptions.showInLegend
member.summary: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotPieOptions.sizeString
member.summary: The diameter of the pie relative to the plot area. Can be a percentage or pixel value. Pixel values are given as integers. Defaults to "75%".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotPieOptions.size
member.summary: The diameter of the pie relative to the plot area. Can be a percentage or pixel value. Pixel values are given as integers. Defaults to "75%".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotPieOptions.slicedOffset
member.summary: If a point is sliced, moved out from the center, how many pixels should it be moved?. Defaults to 10.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotPieOptions.states
member.summary: A wrapper object for all the series options in specific states.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotPieOptions.stickyTracking
member.summary: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotPieOptions.tooltip
member.summary: A configuration object for the tooltip rendering of each single series. Properties are inherited from tooltip. Overridable properties are headerFormat, pointFormat, valueDecimals, xDateFormat, valuePrefix and valueSuffix. Defaults to {}.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotPieOptions.visible
member.summary: Set the initial visibility of the series. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotPieOptions.zIndex
member.summary: Define the z index of the series. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.allowPointSelect
member.summary: Allow this series' points to be selected by clicking on the markers, bars or pie slices. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.animation
member.summary: Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. Since version 2.1, the animation can be set as a configuration object. Please note that this option only applies to the initial animation of the series itself. For other animations, see #chart.animation and the animation parameter under the API methods. The following properties are supported: duration: The duration of the animation in milliseconds. easing: When using jQuery as the general framework, the easing can be set to linear or swing. More easing functions are available with the use of jQuery plug-ins, most notably the jQuery UI suite. See the jQuery docs. When using MooToos as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing. . For polar charts, the animation is disabled in legacy IE browsers. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.animationBoolean
member.summary: Enable or disable the initial animation when a series is displayed. Since version 2.1, the animation can be set as a configuration object. Please note that this option only applies to the initial animation of the series itself. For other animations, see #chart.animation and the animation parameter under the API methods. When using MooToos as the general framework, use the property name transition instead of easing. . For polar charts, the animation is disabled in legacy IE browsers. Defaults to true.
