member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.color
member.summary: The main color or the series. In line type series it applies to the line and the point markers unless otherwise specified. In bar type series it applies to the bars unless a color is specified per point. The default value is pulled from the options.colors array.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.connectNulls
member.summary: Whether to connect a graph line across null points. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.dataLabels
member.summary: Whether to connect a graph line across null points. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.cropThreshold
member.summary: /When the series contains less points than the crop threshold, all points are drawn, event if the points fall outside the visible plot area at the current zoom. The advantage of drawing all points (including markers and columns), is that animation is performed on updates. On the other hand, when the series contains more points than the crop threshold, the series data is cropped to only contain points that fall within the plot area. The advantage of cropping away invisible points is to increase performance on large series. . Defaults to 300.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.cursor
member.summary: You can set the cursor to "pointer" if you have click events attached to the series, to signal to the user that the points and lines can be clicked. Defaults to ''.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.dashStyle
member.summary: A name for the dash style to use for the graph. Applies only to series type having a graph, like line, spline, area and scatter in case it has a lineWidth. The value for the dashStyle include: Solid ShortDash ShortDot ShortDashDot ShortDashDotDot Dot Dash LongDash DashDot LongDashDot LongDashDotDot . Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.enableMouseTracking
member.summary: Enable or disable the mouse tracking for a specific series. This includes point tooltips and click events on graphs and points. For large datasets it improves performance. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.id
member.summary: An id for the series. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the series object through chart.get(). Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.lineWidth
member.summary: Pixel with of the graph line. Defaults to 2.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.point
member.summary: Properties for each single point

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.pointInterval
member.summary: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointInterval defines the interval of the x values. For example, if a series contains one value every decade starting from year 0, set pointInterval to 10. . Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.pointPlacement
member.summary: Possible values: null, "on", "between". In a column chart, when pointPlacement is "on", the point will not create any padding of the X axis. In a polar column chart this means that the first column points directly north. If the pointPlacement is "between", the columns will be laid out between ticks. This is useful for example for visualising an amount between two points in time or in a certain sector of a polar chart. Defaults to null in cartesian charts, "between" in polar charts.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.pointStart
member.summary: If no x values are given for the points in a series, pointStart defines on what value to start. For example, if a series contains one yearly value starting from 1945, set pointStart to 1945. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.selected
member.summary: Whether to select the series initially. If showCheckbox is true, the checkbox next to the series name will be checked for a selected series. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.shadowBoolean
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.shadowObject
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.shadow
member.summary: The shadow of the box. Works best with borderWidth or backgroundColor. Since 2.3 the shadow can be an object configuration containing color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity and width. Defaults to false.

member.summary: If true, a checkbox is displayed next to the legend item to allow selecting the series. The state of the checkbox is determined by the selected option. Defaults to false.

member.summary: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.tooltip
member.summary: A configuration object for the tooltip rendering of each single series. Properties are inherited from tooltip. Overridable properties are headerFormat, pointFormat, valueDecimals, xDateFormat, valuePrefix and valueSuffix. Defaults to {}.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotScatterOptions.turboThreshold
member.summary: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Defaults to 1000.

member.summary: Set the initial visibility of the series. Defaults to true.

member.summary: Define the z index of the series. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotSplineOptions.showInLegend
member.summary: Whether to display this particular series or series type in the legend. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotSplineOptions.stacking
member.summary: Whether to stack the values of each series on top of each other. Possible values are null to disable, "normal" to stack by value or "percent". Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotSplineOptions.states
member.summary: A wrapper object for all the series options in specific states.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotSplineOptions.stickyTracking
member.summary: Sticky tracking of mouse events. When true, the mouseOut event on a series isn't triggered until the mouse moves over another series, or out of the plot area. When false, the mouseOut event on a series is triggered when the mouse leaves the area around the series' graph or markers. This also implies the tooltip. When stickyTracking is false, the tooltip will be hidden when moving the mouse between series. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotSplineOptions.threshold
member.summary: The Y axis value to serve as the base for the area, for distinguishing between values above and below a threshold. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotSplineOptions.tooltip
member.summary: A configuration object for the tooltip rendering of each single series. Properties are inherited from tooltip. Overridable properties are headerFormat, pointFormat, valueDecimals, xDateFormat, valuePrefix and valueSuffix. Defaults to {}.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotSplineOptions.trackByArea
member.summary: Whether the whole area or just the line should respond to mouseover tooltips and other mouse or touch events. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotSplineOptions.turboThreshold
member.summary: When a series contains a data array that is longer than this, only one dimensional arrays of numbers, or two dimensional arrays with x and y values are allowed. Also, only the first point is tested, and the rest are assumed to be the same format. This saves expensive data checking and indexing in long series. Defaults to 1000.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotSplineOptions.visible
member.summary: Set the initial visibility of the series. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotSplineOptions.zIndex
member.summary: Define the z index of the series. Defaults to null.

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.SeriesOptions
member.summary: The actual series to append to the chart. In addition to the members listed below, any member of the plotOptions for that specific type of plot can be added to a series individually. For example, even though a general lineWidth is specified in plotOptions.series, an individual lineWidth can be specified for each series.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.SeriesOptions.data
member.summary:
An array of data points for the series. The points can be given in three ways: A list of numerical values. In this case, the numberical values will be interpreted and y values, and x values will be automatically calculated, either starting at 0 and incrementing by 1, or from pointStart and pointInterval given in the plotOptions. If the axis is has categories, these will be used. This option is not available for range series. Example: data: [0, 5, 3, 5] A list of arrays with two values. In this case, the first value is the x value and the second is the y value. If the first value is a string, it is applied as the name of the point, and the x value is incremented following the above rules.
For range series, the arrays will be interpreted as [x, low, high]. In this cases, the X value can be skipped altogether to make use of pointStart and pointRange.
Example: data: [[5, 2], [6, 3], [8, 2]] A list of object with named values. In this case the objects are point configuration objects as seen below.
Range series values are given by low and high.
Example: data: [{ name: 'Point 1', color: '#00FF00', y: 0 }, { name: 'Point 2', color: '#FF00FF', y: 5 }]

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.SeriesOptions.dataParser
member.summary: *Deprecated* This method is deprecated as of version 2.0. Instead, use options preprocessing as described in the how-to, section #3.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.SeriesOptions.dataURL
member.summary: *Deprecated* This method is deprecated as of version 2.0. Instead, load the data using jQuery.ajax and use options preprocessing as described in the how-to, section #3. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.SeriesOptions.index
member.summary: The index of the series in the chart, affecting the internal index in the chart.series array, the visible Z index as well as the order in the legend. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.SeriesOptions.legendIndex
member.summary: The sequential index of the series in the legend.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.SeriesOptions.name
member.summary: The name of the series as shown in the legend, tooltip etc. Defaults to "".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.SeriesOptions.stack
member.summary: This option allows grouping series in a stacked chart. The stack option can be a string or a number or anything else, as long as the grouped series' stack options match each other. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.SeriesOptions.type
member.summary: The type of series. Can be one of area, areaspline, bar, column, line, pie, scatter or spline. From version 2.3, arearange, areasplinerange and columnrange are supported with the highcharts-more.js component. Defaults to "line".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.SeriesOptions.xAxis
member.summary: When using dual or multiple x axes, this number defines which xAxis the particular series is connected to. It refers to the index of the axis in the xAxis array, with 0 being the first. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.SeriesOptions.yAxis
member.summary: When using dual or multiple y axes, this number defines which yAxis the particular series is connected to. It refers to the index of the axis in the yAxis array, with 0 being the first. Defaults to 0.

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.SeriesDataOptions
member.summary:
An array of data points for the series. The points can be given in three ways: A list of numerical values. In this case, the numberical values will be interpreted and y values, and x values will be automatically calculated, either starting at 0 and incrementing by 1, or from pointStart and pointInterval given in the plotOptions. If the axis is has categories, these will be used. This option is not available for range series. Example: data: [0, 5, 3, 5] A list of arrays with two values. In this case, the first value is the x value and the second is the y value. If the first value is a string, it is applied as the name of the point, and the x value is incremented following the above rules.
For range series, the arrays will be interpreted as [x, low, high]. In this cases, the X value can be skipped altogether to make use of pointStart and pointRange.
Example: data: [[5, 2], [6, 3], [8, 2]] A list of object with named values. In this case the objects are point configuration objects as seen below.
Range series values are given by low and high.
Example: data: [{ name: 'Point 1', color: '#00FF00', y: 0 }, { name: 'Point 2', color: '#FF00FF', y: 5 }]

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions
member.summary: The X axis or category axis. Normally this is the horizontal axis, though if the chart is inverted this is the vertical axis. In case of multiple axes, the xAxis node is an array of configuration objects. See the Axis object for programmatic access to the axis.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.allowDecimals
member.summary: Whether to allow decimals in this axis' ticks. When counting integers, like persons or hits on a web page, decimals must be avoided in the axis tick labels. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.alternateGridColor
member.summary: When using an alternate grid color, a band is painted across the plot area between every other grid line. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.categories
member.summary: If categories are present for the xAxis, names are used instead of numbers for that axis. Example: categories: ['Apples', 'Bananas', 'Oranges'] Defaults to []. Defaults to [].

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.dateTimeLabelFormats
member.summary: For a datetime axis, the scale will automatically adjust to the appropriate unit. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat. Defaults to: { second: '%H:%M:%S', minute: '%H:%M', hour: '%H:%M', day: '%e. %b', week: '%e. %b', month: '%b \'%y', year: '%Y' }

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.endOnTick
member.summary: Whether to force the axis to end on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis end. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.events
member.summary: Event handlers for the axis.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.gridLineColor
member.summary: Color of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area. Defaults to "#C0C0C0".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.gridLineDashStyle
member.summary: The dash or dot style of the grid lines. For possible values, see this demonstration. Defaults to Solid.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.gridLineWidth
member.summary: The width of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.id
member.summary: An id for the axis. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the axis object through chart.get(). Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.labels
member.summary: The axis labels show the number or category for each tick.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.lineColor
member.summary: The color of the line marking the axis itself. Defaults to "#C0D0E0".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.lineWidth
member.summary: The width of the line marking the axis itself. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.linkedTo
member.summary: Index of another axis that this axis is linked to. When an axis is linked to a master axis, it will take the same extremes as the master, but as assigned by min or max or by setExtremes. It can be used to show additional info, or to ease reading the chart by duplicating the scales. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.max
member.summary: The maximum value of the axis. If null, the max value is automatically calculated. If the endOnTick option is true, the max value might be rounded up. The actual maximum value is also influenced by chart.alignTicks. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.maxPadding
member.summary: Padding of the max value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the highest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area. When the axis' max option is set or a max extreme is set using axis.setExtremes(), the maxPadding will be ignored. Defaults to 0.01.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.maxZoom
member.summary: Deprecated. Renamed to minRange as of Highcharts 2.2.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.min
member.summary: The minimum value of the axis. If null the min value is automatically calculated. If the startOnTick option is true, the min value might be rounded down. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.minPadding
member.summary: Padding of the min value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the lowest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area. When the axis' min option is set or a min extreme is set using axis.setExtremes(), the minPadding will be ignored. Defaults to 0.01.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.minRange
member.summary: The minimum range to display on this axis. The entire axis will not be allowed to span over a smaller interval than this. For example, for a datetime axis the main unit is milliseconds. If minRange is set to 3600000, you can't zoom in more than to one hour. The default minRange for the x axis is five times the smallest interval between any of the data points. On a logarithmic axis, the unit for the minimum range is the power. So a minRange of 1 means that the axis can be zoomed to 10-100, 100-1000, 1000-10000 etc.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.minTickInterval
member.summary: The minimum tick interval allowed in axis values. For example on zooming in on an axis with daily data, this can be used to prevent the axis from showing hours. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.minorGridLineColor
member.summary: Color of the minor, secondary grid lines. Defaults to #E0E0E0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.minorGridLineDashStyle
member.summary: The dash or dot style of the minor grid lines. For possible values, see this demonstration. Defaults to Solid.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.minorGridLineWidth
member.summary: Width of the minor, secondary grid lines. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.minorTickColor
member.summary: Color for the minor tick marks. Defaults to #A0A0A0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.minorTickInterval
member.summary: Tick interval in scale units for the minor ticks. On a linear axis, if "auto", the minor tick interval is calculated as a fifth of the tickInterval. If null, minor ticks are not shown. On logarithmic axes, the unit is the power of the value. For example, setting the minorTickInterval to 1 puts one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. Setting the minorTickInterval to 0.1 produces 9 ticks between 1 and 10, 10 and 100 etc. A minorTickInterval of "auto" on a log axis results in a best guess, attempting to enter approximately 5 minor ticks between each major tick. . Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.minorTickLength
member.summary: The pixel length of the minor tick marks. Defaults to 2.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.minorTickPosition
member.summary: The position of the minor tick marks relative to the axis line. Can be one of inside and outside. Defaults to outside.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.minorTickWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the minor tick mark. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.offset
member.summary: The distance in pixels from the plot area to the axis line. A positive offset moves the axis with it's line, labels and ticks away from the plot area. This is typically used when two or more axes are displayed on the same side of the plot. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.opposite
member.summary: Whether to display the axis on the opposite side of the normal. The normal is on the left side for vertical axes and bottom for horizontal, so the opposite sides will be right and top respectively. This is typically used with dual or multiple axes. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.plotBands
member.summary: A colored band stretching across the plot area marking an interval on the axis.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.plotLines
member.summary: A line streching across the plot area, marking a specific value on one of the axes.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.reversed
member.summary: Whether to reverse the axis so that the highest number is closest to origo. If the chart is inverted, the x axis is reversed by default. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.showEmpty
member.summary: Whether to show the axis line and title when the axis has no data. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.showFirstLabel
member.summary: Whether to show the first tick label. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.showLastLabel
member.summary: Whether to show the last tick label. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.startOfWeek
member.summary: For datetime axes, this decides where to put the tick between weeks. 0 = Sunday, 1 = Monday. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.startOnTick
member.summary: Whether to force the axis to start on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis start. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.tickColor
member.summary: Color for the main tick marks. Defaults to #C0D0E0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.tickInterval
member.summary: The interval of the tick marks in axis units. When null, the tick interval is computed to approximately follow the tickPixelInterval on linear and datetime axes. On categorized axes, a null tickInterval will default to 1, one category. Note that datetime axes are based on milliseconds, so for example an interval of one day is expressed as 24 * 3600 * 1000. On logarithmic axes, the tickInterval is based on powers, so a tickInterval of 1 means one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. A tickInterval of 2 means a tick of 0.1, 10, 1000 etc. A tickInterval of 0.2 puts a tick on 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 20, 40 etc. . Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.tickLength
member.summary: The pixel length of the main tick marks. Defaults to 5.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.tickPixelInterval
member.summary: If tickInterval is null this option sets the approximate pixel interval of the tick marks. Not applicable to categorized axis. Defaults to 72 for the Y axis and 100 for the X axis.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.tickPosition
member.summary: The position of the major tick marks relative to the axis line. Can be one of inside and outside. Defaults to "outside".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.tickWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the major tick marks. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.tickmarkPlacement
member.summary: For categorized axes only. If "on" the tick mark is placed in the center of the category, if "between" the tick mark is placed between categories. Defaults to "between".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.title
member.summary: The axis title, showing next to the axis line.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.XAxisOptions.type
member.summary: The type of axis. Can be one of "linear", "logarithmic" or "datetime". In a datetime axis, the numbers are given in milliseconds, and tick marks are placed on appropriate values like full hours or days. Defaults to "linear".

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.AxisEvent

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.AxisEvent.setExtremes
member.summary: Fires when the minimum and maximum is set for the axis, either by calling the .setExtremes() method or by selecting an area in the chart. The this keyword refers to the axis object itself. One parameter, event, is passed to the function. This contains common event information based on jQuery or MooTools depending on which library is used as the base for Highcharts. The new user set minimum and maximum values can be found by event.min and event.max.

member.summary: The width or thickness of the plot line. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.AxisPlotLinesOptions.zIndex
member.summary: The z index of the plot line within the chart. Defaults to null.

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotLinesLabelOptions
member.summary: Text labels for the plot bands

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotLinesLabelOptions.align
member.summary: Horizontal alignment of the label. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right". Defaults to "center".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotLinesLabelOptions.rotation
member.summary: Rotation of the text label in degrees. Defaults to 0 for horizontal plot lines and 90 for vertical lines.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotLinesLabelOptions.style
member.summary: CSS styles for the text label.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotLinesLabelOptions.textAlign
member.summary: The text alignment for the label. While align determines where the texts anchor point is placed within the plot band, textAlign determines how the text is aligned against its anchor point. Possible values are "left", "center" and "right". Defaults to the same as the align option.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotLinesLabelOptions.verticalAlign
member.summary: Vertical alignment of the label relative to the plot band. Can be one of "top", "middle" or "bottom". Defaults to "top".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotLinesLabelOptions.x
member.summary: Horizontal position relative the alignment. Default varies by orientation.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.PlotLinesLabelOptions.y
member.summary: Vertical position of the text baseline relative to the alignment. Default varies by orientation.

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.AxisTitleOptions
member.summary: The axis title, showing next to the axis line.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.AxisTitleOptions.align
member.summary: Alignment of the title relative to the axis values. Possible values are "low", "middle" or "high". Defaults to "middle".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.AxisTitleOptions.enabled
member.summary: Deprecated. Set the text to null to disable the title.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.AxisTitleOptions.margin
member.summary: The pixel distance between the axis labels or line and the title. Defaults to 0 for horizontal axes, 10 for vertical

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.AxisTitleOptions.offset
member.summary: The distance of the axis title from the axis line. By default, this distance is computed from the offset width of the labels, the labels' distance from the axis and the title's margin. However when the offset option is set, it overrides all this. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.AxisTitleOptions.rotation
member.summary: The rotation of the text in degrees. 0 is horizontal, 270 is vertical reading from bottom to top. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.AxisTitleOptions.style
P:SharpKit.Highcharts.AxisTitleOptions.text
member.summary: The actual text of the axis title. It can contain basic HTML text markup like <b>, <i> and spans with style. Defaults to null.

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.AxisTitleAlignType
member.summary: Alignment of the title relative to the axis values. Possible values are "low", "middle" or "high".

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.AxisType
member.summary: The type of axis. Can be one of "linear", "logarithmic" or "datetime". In a datetime axis, the numbers are given in milliseconds, and tick marks are placed on appropriate values like full hours or days

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions
member.summary: The Y axis or value axis. Normally this is the vertical axis, though if the chart is inverted this is the horiontal axis. In case of multiple axes, the yAxis node is an array of configuration objects. See the Axis object for programmatic access to the axis.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.allowDecimals
member.summary: Whether to allow decimals in this axis' ticks. When counting integers, like persons or hits on a web page, decimals must be avoided in the axis tick labels. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.alternateGridColor
member.summary: When using an alternate grid color, a band is painted across the plot area between every other grid line. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.categories
member.summary: If categories are present for the xAxis, names are used instead of numbers for that axis. Example: categories: ['Apples', 'Bananas', 'Oranges'] Defaults to [].

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.dateTimeLabelFormats
member.summary: For a datetime axis, the scale will automatically adjust to the appropriate unit. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit. For an overview of the replacement codes, see dateFormat. Defaults to: { second: '%H:%M:%S', minute: '%H:%M', hour: '%H:%M', day: '%e. %b', week: '%e. %b', month: '%b \'%y', year: '%Y' }

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.endOnTick
member.summary: Whether to force the axis to end on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis end. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.events
member.summary: Event handlers for the axis.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.gridLineColor
member.summary: Color of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area. Defaults to "#C0C0C0".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.gridLineDashStyle
member.summary: The dash or dot style of the grid lines. For possible values, see this demonstration. Defaults to Solid.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.gridLineWidth
member.summary: The width of the grid lines extending the ticks across the plot area. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.id
member.summary: An id for the axis. This can be used after render time to get a pointer to the axis object through chart.get(). Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.labels
member.summary: The axis labels show the number or category for each tick.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.lineColor
member.summary: The color of the line marking the axis itself. Defaults to "#C0D0E0".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.lineWidth
member.summary: The width of the line marking the axis itself. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.linkedTo
member.summary: Index of another axis that this axis is linked to. When an axis is linked to a master axis, it will take the same extremes as the master, but as assigned by min or max or by setExtremes. It can be used to show additional info, or to ease reading the chart by duplicating the scales. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.max
member.summary: The maximum value of the axis. If null, the max value is automatically calculated. If the endOnTick option is true, the max value might be rounded up. The actual maximum value is also influenced by chart.alignTicks. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.maxPadding
member.summary: Padding of the max value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the highest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area. Defaults to 0.05.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.maxZoom
member.summary: Deprecated. Renamed to minRange as of Highcharts 2.2.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.min
member.summary: The minimum value of the axis. If null the min value is automatically calculated. If the startOnTick option is true, the min value might be rounded down. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.minPadding
member.summary: Padding of the min value relative to the length of the axis. A padding of 0.05 will make a 100px axis 5px longer. This is useful when you don't want the lowest data value to appear on the edge of the plot area. Defaults to 0.05.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.minRange
member.summary: The minimum range to display on this axis. The entire axis will not be allowed to span over a smaller interval than this. For example, for a datetime axis the main unit is milliseconds. If minRange is set to 3600000, you can't zoom in more than to one hour. The default minRange for the x axis is five times the smallest interval between any of the data points. On a logarithmic axis, the unit for the minimum range is the power. So a minRange of 1 means that the axis can be zoomed to 10-100, 100-1000, 1000-10000 etc.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.minTickInterval
member.summary: The minimum tick interval allowed in axis values. For example on zooming in on an axis with daily data, this can be used to prevent the axis from showing hours. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.minorGridLineColor
member.summary: Color of the minor, secondary grid lines. Defaults to #E0E0E0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.minorGridLineDashStyle
member.summary: The dash or dot style of the minor grid lines. For possible values, see this demonstration. Defaults to Solid.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.minorGridLineWidth
member.summary: Width of the minor, secondary grid lines. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.minorTickColor
member.summary: Color for the minor tick marks. Defaults to #A0A0A0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.minorTickInterval
member.summary: Tick interval in scale units for the minor ticks. On a linear axis, if "auto", the minor tick interval is calculated as a fifth of the tickInterval. If null, minor ticks are not shown. On logarithmic axes, the unit is the power of the value. For example, setting the minorTickInterval to 1 puts one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. Setting the minorTickInterval to 0.1 produces 9 ticks between 1 and 10, 10 and 100 etc. A minorTickInterval of "auto" on a log axis results in a best guess, attempting to enter approximately 5 minor ticks between each major tick. . Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.minorTickLength
member.summary: The pixel length of the minor tick marks. Defaults to 2.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.minorTickPosition
member.summary: The position of the minor tick marks relative to the axis line. Can be one of inside and outside. Defaults to outside.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.minorTickWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the minor tick mark. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.offset
member.summary: The distance in pixels from the plot area to the axis line. A positive offset moves the axis with it's line, labels and ticks away from the plot area. This is typically used when two or more axes are displayed on the same side of the plot. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.opposite
member.summary: Whether to display the axis on the opposite side of the normal. The normal is on the left side for vertical axes and bottom for horizontal, so the opposite sides will be right and top respectively. This is typically used with dual or multiple axes. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.plotBands
member.summary: A colored band stretching across the plot area marking an interval on the axis.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.plotLines
member.summary: A line streching across the plot area, marking a specific value on one of the axes.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.reversed
member.summary: Whether to reverse the axis so that the highest number is closest to origo. If the chart is inverted, the x axis is reversed by default. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.showEmpty
member.summary: Whether to show the axis line and title when the axis has no data. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.showFirstLabel
member.summary: Whether to show the first tick label. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.showLastLabel
member.summary: Whether to show the last tick label. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.stackLabels
member.summary: The stack labels show the total value for each bar in a stacked column or bar chart. The label will be placed on top of positive columns and below negative columns. In case of an inverted column chart or a bar chart the label is placed to the right of positive bars and to the left of negative bars.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.startOfWeek
member.summary: For datetime axes, this decides where to put the tick between weeks. 0 = Sunday, 1 = Monday. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.startOnTick
member.summary: Whether to force the axis to start on a tick. Use this option with the maxPadding option to control the axis start. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.tickColor
member.summary: Color for the main tick marks. Defaults to #C0D0E0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.tickInterval
member.summary: The interval of the tick marks in axis units. When null, the tick interval is computed to approximately follow the tickPixelInterval on linear and datetime axes. On categorized axes, a null tickInterval will default to 1, one category. Note that datetime axes are based on milliseconds, so for example an interval of one day is expressed as 24 * 3600 * 1000. On logarithmic axes, the tickInterval is based on powers, so a tickInterval of 1 means one tick on each of 0.1, 1, 10, 100 etc. A tickInterval of 2 means a tick of 0.1, 10, 1000 etc. A tickInterval of 0.2 puts a tick on 0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 20, 40 etc. . Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.tickLength
member.summary: The pixel length of the main tick marks. Defaults to 5.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.tickPixelInterval
member.summary: If tickInterval is null this option sets the approximate pixel interval of the tick marks. Not applicable to categorized axis. Defaults to 72 for the Y axis and 100 for the X axis.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.tickPosition
member.summary: The position of the major tick marks relative to the axis line. Can be one of inside and outside. Defaults to "outside".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.tickWidth
member.summary: The pixel width of the major tick marks. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.tickmarkPlacement
member.summary: For categorized axes only. If "on" the tick mark is placed in the center of the category, if "between" the tick mark is placed between categories. Defaults to "between".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.title
member.summary: The axis title, showing next to the axis line.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisOptions.type
member.summary: The type of axis. Can be one of "linear", "logarithmic" or "datetime". In a datetime axis, the numbers are given in milliseconds, and tick marks are placed on appropriate values like full hours or days. Defaults to "linear".

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisLabelsOptions
member.summary: The axis labels show the number or category for each tick.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisLabelsOptions.align
member.summary: What part of the string the given position is anchored to. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right". Defaults to "right".

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisLabelsOptions.enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the axis labels. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisLabelsOptions.formatter
P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisLabelsOptions.overflow
member.summary: How to handle overflowing labels on horizontal axis. Can be undefined or "justify". If "justify", labels will not render outside the plot area. If there is room to move it, it will be aligned to the edge, else it will be removed. Defaults to undefined.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisLabelsOptions.rotation
member.summary: Rotation of the labels in degrees. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisLabelsOptions.staggerLines
member.summary: Horizontal axes only. The number of lines to spread the labels over to make room or tighter labels. . Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisLabelsOptions.step
member.summary: To show only every n'th label on the axis, set the step to n. Setting the step to 2 shows every other label. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisLabelsOptions.style
P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisLabelsOptions.x
member.summary: The x position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. Defaults to -8.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisLabelsOptions.y
member.summary: The y position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. Defaults to 3.

member.name: T:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsOptions
member.summary: The stack labels show the total value for each bar in a stacked column or bar chart. The label will be placed on top of positive columns and below negative columns. In case of an inverted column chart or a bar chart the label is placed to the right of positive bars and to the left of negative bars.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsOptions.align
member.summary: Defines the horizontal alignment of the stack total label. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right". The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsOptions.enabled
member.summary: Enable or disable the stack total labels. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsOptions.formatter
P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsOptions.rotation
member.summary: Rotation of the labels in degrees. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsOptions.style
P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsOptions.textAlign
member.summary: The text alignment for the label. While align determines where the texts anchor point is placed with regards to the stack, textAlign determines how the text is aligned against its anchor point. Possible values are "left", "center" and "right". The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsOptions.verticalAlign
member.summary: Defines the vertical alignment of the stack total label. Can be one of "top", "middle" or "bottom". The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsOptions.x
member.summary: The x position offset of the label relative to the left of the stacked bar. The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.

member.name: P:SharpKit.Highcharts.YAxisStackLabelsOptions.y
member.summary: The y position offset of the label relative to the tick position on the axis. The default value is calculated at runtime and depends on orientation and whether the stack is positive or negative.
